field.name: selectedfiles
field.label: Selected Files
field.description: Selected files will be cleared by closing folder

field.name: impcat
field.label: Joomla Category
field.description: Default item categories are specified in global options. Here you can override to create a category based on import date for all item types created when importing from track file ID3 data

field.name: splitsongs
field.label: Split medley to songs
field.description: attempt to split track titles containing , or / into separate songs

field.name: nobrackets
field.label: Song Title remove brackets
field.description: Remove text in square or round brackets when cresating song titles. Often this is used to indicate a live performance or recording date, but sometimes may be a valid part of the title. eg 'Have You Ever Been (to Electric Ladyland)

field.name: fmnote1
field.label: Music Files
field.description: Music files are hardcoded to a folder xbmusic/ in the root of the joomla installation. To include files from a different location on the server you can create a symlink to the target folder below. You must ensure that the WebServer user has read and write access to the folder. For most common Apache2 installations the user is www-data. It may be simplest to make the target nusic folder read-write for all users (chmod -R 777 [targetfolderpath]), The server will need to be able to read the entire path to the target and have read+write permissions for the target folder and subfolders

field.name: link_target
field.label: New Symlink Target
field.description: Enter the absolute path to the target folder where music files are stored

field.name: link_name
field.label: Link name in /xbmusic
field.description: Enter the name without path for the new symlink. Must not be an existing folder or file in xbmusic/ and the path must exist in xbmusic

field.name: fmnote2
field.description: Once you have created the symlink and imported tracks from it you must not delete it without first deleting all the tracks and related info
